qas.question: What are two examples of high quality microphones?

answers.text: moving coil microphone was introduced around 1930 and the velocity or ribbon microphone

qas.question: What was used to dampen resonances in recordings?
When would you have first found the moving coil microphone?
What was a more economical option to magnetic pickups?
In what years would you find electronic recordings played electronically?

context: Eventually, when it was more common for electric recordings to be played back electrically in the <a4_0>1930s and 1940s<a4_0/>, the overall tone was much like listening to a radio of the era. <a1_0>Magnetic pickups<a1_0/> became more common and were better designed as time went on, making it possible to improve the damping of spurious resonances. <a3_0>Crystal pickups<a3_0/> were also introduced as lower cost alternatives. The dynamic or <a0_0>moving coil microphone was introduced <a2_0>around 1930<a2_0/> and the velocity or ribbon microphone<a0_0/> in 1932. Both of these high quality microphones became widespread in motion picture, radio, recording, and public address applications.
